qas.question: Who confessed that wrestling was not competition?

answers.text: prominent figures in the wrestling business (including WWE owner Vince McMahon)

qas.question: How have people reacted to the revelation that wrestling is purely entertainment?

answers.text: This public reveal has garnered mixed reactions from the wrestling community

qas.question: How do many U.S. states handle wrestling?

answers.text: many U.S. states still regulate professional wrestling as they do other professional competitive sports

context: Gradually, the predetermined nature of professional wrestling became an open secret, as <a0_0>prominent figures in the wrestling business (including WWE owner Vince McMahon)<a0_0/> began to publicly admit that wrestling was entertainment, not competition. <a1_0>This public reveal has garnered mixed reactions from the wrestling community<a1_0/>, as some feel that exposure ruins the experience to the spectators as does exposure in illusionism. Despite the public admission of the theatrical nature of professional wrestling, <a2_0>many U.S. states still regulate professional wrestling as they do other professional competitive sports<a2_0/>. For example, New York State still regulates "professional wrestling" through the New York State Athletic Commission (SAC).
